column4: I have a problem with cron :(  The cron.daily scripts are meant to run at 3.25am but are running at 7.30-8.00am why ?
UTC?
I don't know, the 'date' program gives the correct time.
... modulo s/self/<PID>/ there as that looks at the calling process.
What's your TZ offset?  'date -R' gives that in RFC 2822 (mail) format
sydney/australia = +11 atm
Nope, it's not that then.  You have cron or anacron installed?
by my calculations, that would mean an 2pm if it was using UTC.
it appears to have both.
anacron can result in jobs not running when scheduled.  You also want to check TZ values for cron and such.  You can examine a running cron process's environment in /proc/<PID>/env
maybe I should stop anacron
It's an ascii-nul terminated string, so you'll need to unpack it....
tr -s '\000' '\n' < /proc/self/environ | grep ^TZ=
... otoh you could schedule that as a cronjob to see what's happening.
root to read another user's process, natch.
this computer is a server, and spends most of it time on, shouldn't it be ok to disable anacron ?
Yes.  I'd purge it frankly.
when I go to purge anacron apt-get asks to  remove "anacron* ubuntu-desktop*" !!  is this safe ?
thanks for the help.
I'm not sure.  ubuntu-desktop may be virtual and not actually remove anything.
it is a 'meta package', I purged anacron this should fix the problem.
Cool.
